trans-unit.source: The **nxGroup** resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage local groups on a Linux node.
trans-unit.target: The **nxGroup** resource in PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage local groups on a Linux node.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the group for which you want to ensure a specific state.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the group for which you want to ensure a specific state.

trans-unit.source: Determines whether to check if the group exists.
trans-unit.target: Determines whether to check if the group exists.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Present" to ensure the group exists.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Present" to ensure the group exists.

trans-unit.source: Set it to "Absent" to ensure the group does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Set it to "Absent" to ensure the group does not exist.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the members that form the group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the members that form the group.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the users who you want to ensure are members of the group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the users who you want to ensure are members of the group.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the users who you want to ensure are not members of the group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the users who you want to ensure are not members of the group.

trans-unit.source: Sets the group id to the provided value if possible.
trans-unit.target: Sets the group id to the provided value if possible.

trans-unit.source: If the group id is currently in use, the next available group id is used.
trans-unit.target: If the group id is currently in use, the next available group id is used.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the **ID** of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is
trans-unit.target: For example, if the **ID** of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is **ResourceName** and its type is **ResourceType**, the syntax for using this property is

trans-unit.source: The following example ensures that the user “monuser” exists and is a member of the group "DBusers".
trans-unit.target: The following example ensures that the user “monuser” exists and is a member of the group "DBusers".
